step1.sentence: She turned on the small lamp beside her bed and started reading her novel.

step2.story: It was a cold winter morning and the entire house felt freezing. Dad turned on the heater as soon as he came downstairs in his slippers, and within a few minutes the living room grew comfortably warm.

step3.story: When the family arrived at their rented vacation cabin, everything inside looked dark and a little dusty. The kids immediately rushed around turning on every light in every room. Mom found an old radio in the kitchen and turned it on; it played a cheerful folk song. Soon the cabin felt alive and full of energy, ready for the weekend ahead.

meaning.realUsageKo: 전등, TV, 히터 등 전자기기의 전원을 켤 때 사용하는 가장 기본적인 표현입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: turn(돌리다)과 on(작동)이 결합하여 스위치를 돌려 전원을 넣는다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: turn off의 반대말로 세트로 익히면 좋습니다. switch on과 의미가 같으며 일상에서 더 자주 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Could you turn on the fan? It is really hot in here.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 선풍기 좀 켜줄 수 있어요? 여기 너무 더워요.
